Title: General Motors
fem_bios: Ms. Mary T. Barra serves as the Chief Executive Officer of General Motors of Canada Limited. Ms. Barra has been the Chief Executive Officer of General Motors Company January 15, 2014. She was named one of Automotive News' 100 Leading Women in the North American Auto Industry“ in 2005 and again in 2010. In 2010, she earned Kettering Alumni Association's Management Achievement Award for her specific contributions with positive and lasting effects in the field of management. She received a GM fellowship to the Stanford Graduate School of Business. Ms. Barra holds a Bachelor of Science degree in electrical engineering from General Motors Institute (Kettering University) in 1985. She holds an MBA in Business Administration from Stanford Graduate School of Business in 1990.

Title: Anthem
fem_bios: Ms. Gail Koziara Boudreaux has been President, Chief Executive Officer and Director of Anthem, Inc. since November 11, 2017. She has been honored as one of Fortune's 50 Most Powerful Women in American Business for the last six years and was recognized by Modern Healthcare as one of the Top 25 Women in Healthcare. Ms. Boudreaux holds an M.B.A. degree in Finance and Health Care Administration from the Columbia Business School and a Bachelor's degree in Psychology from Dartmouth College.

Title: IBM
fem_bios: Ms. Virginia M. Rometty, also known as Ginni, has been the Chairman of International Business Machines Corporation (also known as IBM Corp.) since October 1, 2012 and also has been its Chief Executive Officer and President since January 1, 2012. She is a frequent speaker at industry and business conferences around the world, the recipient of the Carl Sloane Award 2006, given by the Association of Management Consulting Firms and was named among Fortune Magazine's “50 Most Powerful Women in Business” in 2005 and 2006 and was named among Time magazine's 2002 Global Business Influential. She holds a Bachelor of Science degree with high honors in computer science and electrical engineering from the Northwestern University.

Title: PepsiCo
fem_bios: Ms. Indra K. Nooyi, M.P.P.M., has been an Independent Director of International Cricket Council since June 2018. Ms. Nooyi has been the Chairman of the Board of PepsiCo, Inc. since May 2, 2007 and served as its Chief Executive Officer from October 1, 2006 to October 3, 2018.   Ms. Nooyi graduated from Madras Christian College in India with a degree in Chemistry, Physics and Math and earned a Master's Degree in Finance and Marketing from the Indian Institute of Management in Calcutta and a Master's Degree in Public and Private Management from Yale University's School of Organization and Management.

Title: Lockheed Martin
fem_bios: Ms. Marillyn A. Hewson has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Lockheed Martin Corporation since January 1, 2013 and has been its Chairman since January 1, 2014. Ms. Hewson has been selected by Fortune magazine as one of the “50 Most Powerful Women in Business” for the past five years and was named #4 in 2014. Ms. Hewson was named #21 on the Forbes “World’s 100 Most Powerful Women” list in 2014. Ms. Hewson holds Bachelor’s Science in Business Administration from University of Alabama, Master of Arts in Economics from University of Alabama, Attended Columbia Business School and Executive Development Program from Harvard Business School.

Title: Oracle
fem_bios: Ms. Safra Ada Catz has been the Chief Executive Officer of Oracle Corporation since September 17, 2014. Ms. Catz served as the President of Oracle Corporation from January 2004 to September 2014 and served as its Chief Financial Officer from April 25, 2011 until September 2014. Ms. Catz served as Chief Financial Officer of Oracle Corporation from November 15, 2005 to September 2008 and also served as its Interim Chief Financial Officer from April 2005 to July 2005.

Title: General Dynamics
fem_bios: Ms. Phebe N. Novakovic has been the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of General Dynamics Corporation since January 1, 2013 and has been its Director since May 2012. Ms. Novakovic served as the President and Chief Operating Officer at General Dynamics Corporation from May 2, 2012 to December 2012. She served as an Executive Vice President of General Dynamics Marine Systems, Inc., from May 01, 2010 to May 2012.

Title: Progressive
fem_bios: Ms. Susan Patricia Griffith, also known as Tricia, has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Progressive Corp. since July 1, 2016. Ms. Griffith was named one of FORTUNE magazine’s “Most Powerful Women in Business” in 2016 and 2017. She has a Bachelor's Degree from Illinois State University and is a graduate of the Wharton School of Business’s Advanced Management Program.

Title: Duke Energy
fem_bios: Ms. Lynn J. Good has been the Chairman of the Board of Edison Electric Institute since June 2018. Ms. Good serves as the President at Duke Energy Carolinas, LLC since July 1, 2013. Ms. Good has been the Chief Executive Officer of Duke Energy Carolinas, LLC and Duke Energy Progress, LLC since July 1, 2013. Ms. Good serves as the Chief Executive Officer of Piedmont Natural Gas Co. Inc. She has been the Chief Executive Officer of Duke Energy Indiana, LLC since July 2013 and was its President since July 2013. In 2014 and 2015, Fortune magazine listed her as 13th among the 'Most Powerful Women in Business.' and in 2013, she was named as one of the 10 most influential people in the energy sector by SNL Energy. Ms. Good holds a Bachelor of Science in Systems Analysis and in Accounting from Miami University, Oxford, Ohio in 1981.

Title: Kohls
fem_bios: Ms. Michelle D. Gass serves as Chief Executive Officer and Director of Kohl's Corporation since May 16, 2018. Ms. Gass was the Chief Merchandising & Customer Officer at Kohl's Corporation since June 2015 until May 2, 2018. She serves as the Chief Merchandising & Customer Officer at Kohl's Department Stores, Inc. She holds Master in Business Administration from University of Washington and Bachelor of Science in Chemical Engineering from Worcester Polytechnic Institute.

Title: PG& E Corp.
fem_bios: Geisha J. Williams is Chief Executive Officer and President of PG&E Corporation. She joined the company in 2007, and has more than three decades of experience in the energy industry. Under Williams’ leadership, PG&E is responsible for providing safe, reliable, affordable and clean energy to 16 million people in northern and central California. In her prior role as President, Electric, Williams led PG&E’s electric business, including transmission, distribution, power generation, nuclear operations, energy procurement and customer care. During her tenure at PG&E, the company has become a leader in renewables integration, grid modernization and smart grid technologies, while also achieving the best electric reliability in company history.

Title: Synchrony Financial
fem_bios: Ms. Margaret M. Keane serves as Director of Allstate Corp. since January 1, 2018 and has been Chief Executive Officer and President of Synchrony Financial since February 2014. Ms. Keane has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Retail Consumer Finance of Americas Operations at General Electric Company since November 29, 2005. Ms. Keane serves as Chief Executive Officer of Retail Finance and President of Retail Finance GE Money Bank (Stamford, CT). Ms. Keane holds a BA in Government/politics and an MBA from St. John's University in Queens, NY.

Title: Ross Stores
fem_bios: Ms. Barbara Rentler has been the Chief Executive Officer of Ross Stores Inc since June 2014. Ms. Rentler served as the President and Chief Merchandising Officer of Ross Dress for Less at Ross Stores Inc since December 2009 until June 2014. She served as Executive Vice President of Merchandising at Ross Stores Inc. from December 11, 2006 to December 2009. Ms. Rentler served as Senior Vice President and General Merchandising Manager of Ross Stores Inc. from March 2001 to February 08, 2005. She has been Director of Ross Stores Inc. since June 2014.

Title: Occidental Petroleum
fem_bios: Ms. Vicki A. Hollub has been the President and Chief Executive Officer at Occidental Petroleum Corporation since December 10, 2015 and April 29, 2016 respectively. Ms. Hollub holds a Bachelor of Science in Mineral Engineering from the University of Alabama. She was inducted into the University of Alabama College of Engineering 2016 class of Distinguished Engineering Fellows.

Title: Reinsurance Group of America
fem_bios: Ms. Anna Manning is the President of Reinsurance Group of America, Incorporated (the “Company”) from December 2015 and has been its Chief Executive Officer from 2017. She holds a B.Sc. in Actuarial Science from the University of Toronto, is a Fellow of the Canadian Institute of Actuaries and a Fellow of the Society of Actuaries.

Title: Guardian Life Ins. Co. of America
fem_bios: Ms. Deanna Marie Mulligan, CLU, ChFC, has been the Chief Executive Officer of The Guardian Life Insurance Company of America since July 1, 2011 and has been its President since November 1, 2010. She received a B.S. in Business Administration from the University of Nebraska and an M.B.A. from Stanford Graduate School of Business.

Title: Hertz Global Holdings
fem_bios: Ms. Kathryn Vanstrom Marinello, also known as Kathy, has been the Chief Executive Officer, President and Director at Hertz Global Holdings, Inc. since January 3, 2017. Ms. Marinello has been the Chief Executive Officer and President at The Hertz Corporation since January 3, 2017. Her many accomplishments included being recognized as an Industry Leader by The Minneapolis/St. Paul Business Journal at its ninth annual Women in Business awards event this year. She holds BA in Liberal Arts from the State University of New York at Albany. Ms. Marinello holds an MBA in Marketing and Business from Hofstra University.

Title: Veritiv
fem_bios: Ms. Mary A. Laschinger has been the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer at Veritiv Corporation since July 2014 and served as its President and Principal Financial Officer. Ms. Laschinger holds a Bachelor’S Degree in Business from the University of Wisconsin and an MBA from the University of Connecticut. She has also completed postgraduate studies in Executive Management at the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University.

Title: Campbell Soup
fem_bios: Ms. Denise M. Morrison served as Chief Executive Officer and President of Campbell Soup Company from August 1, 2011 to May 18, 2018. She is regularly named among the Fortune and Forbes Most Powerful Women. She has been one of Fortune magazine's 'Most Powerful Women in Business' since 1999. In 2006, Ms. Morrison was awarded the Salute to Policy Makers awarded by the Executive Women of New Jersey. In 2003, she was named Executive of the Year by Snack Food & Bakery magazine and received the Althea Gibson Beacon award for business leadership. In 2001, she was appointed to the New York YWCA Academy of Women Achievers. She was inducted into the Order of the Cross and Crown Honor Society for academic and extracurricular achievement. Ms. Morrison earned her B.S. degree in economics and psychology from Boston College, graduating magna cum laude in 1975.

Title: Hershey
fem_bios: Ms. Michele Gross Buck has been the Chief Executive Officer and President at The Hershey Company since March 1, 2017. Ms. Buck is responsible for all day-to-day global operations and commercial activities of Hershey Company. Ms. Buck is ranked as one of Fortune’s Most Powerful Women and serves as the Benefit Co-Chair of the Children’s Brain Tumor Foundation. Ms. Buck holds a Master of Business Administration from the University of North Carolina and a Bachelor of Science degree in business administration from Shippensburg University.

Title: Yum China Holdings
fem_bios: Ms. Joey Wat has been the Chief Executive Officer of Yum! China Holding, Inc since March 1, 2018 and has served as its President and Chief Operating Officer since February 7, 2017 until February 2018. Ms. Wat has been a Director of Yum! China Holding, Inc since July 2017. Ms. Wat served as Chief Executive Officer, KFC from October 2016 to February 2017, a position she held at Yum! Restaurants China from August 2015 to October 2016. Ms. Wat joined Yum! Restaurants China in September 2014 as President of KFC China and was promoted to Chief Executive Officer for KFC China in August 2015.

Title: KeyCorp
fem_bios: Ms. Beth E. Mooney has been the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of KeyCorp. since May 1, 2011 and serves as its President. Ms. Mooney serves as the Chief Executive Officer of KeyBank National Association. In 2006, USBanker magazine listed her as fifth among the nation's top ten banking Chief Financial Officers. She received the YWCA Women of Achievement Award in 2008 and was recognized in USBanker's 'The 25 Most Powerful Women in Banking' editions in 2005, 2006, 2007 and 2008. She was selected as one of the 2007-2008 Distinguished Alumni recipients from the Cox School of Business at Southern Methodist University. Ms. Mooney received her B.A. in history from the University of Texas in 1977 and received her Master of Business Administration Degree from Southern Methodist University in 1983.

Title: Graybar Electric
fem_bios: Ms. Kathleen M. Mazzarella, also known as Kathy, has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Graybar Canada Limited since June 1, 2012. Ms. Mazzarella holds Associate Degree in Telecommunications Engineering and a Bachelor's Degree in Applied Behavioral Sciences before earning her Masters in Business Administration from Webster University.

Title: CMS Energy
fem_bios: Ms. Patricia Kessler Poppe, also known as Patti, has been the Chief Executive Officer and President at CMS Energy Corp. and Consumers Energy Company since July 01, 2016. Ms. Poppe served as an Senior Vice President of Distribution Operations, Transmission & Engineering at CMS Energy Corp. since March 2015 until July 01, 2016. She has been Chairman of the Board, CEO and Director at CMS Enterprises since July 2016 and was its Director since July 2016 until September 2017.

Title: Ulta Beauty
fem_bios: Ms. Mary N. Dillon has been the Chief Executive Officer of Ulta Beauty, Inc. since July 1, 2013 and serves as its President. She was named one of FierceWireless' 'Most Influential Women in Wireless' in 2011. She was Named to Fortune's Business Person of the Year list in 2015. Ms. Dillon received Bachelor of Science in Marketing and Asian Studies from the University of Illinois at Chicago.
